Text.Value: Ketheric was never my concern - I wanted to help Thaniel.
What about you?
Duke Eltan would be proud of what the order has become. A pity they cannot spare the resources to help you with Thaniel.
Thank you, my friend. Maybe we'll meet again, in another life.
I heard about the Dead Three. And, more importantly, Duke Ravengard.
You don't have to worry about me.
You're alive - isn't that something to be grateful about?
Don't worry about me, please focus on saving Thaniel.
So consider this a dying man's wish. Help Duke Ravengard... save the city. Please.
It's only fair I stay here and wait for him to awaken.
How did you make it here?
Maybe. I don't know what this Duke Ravengard is like.
Thaniel...
You saved Thaniel, lifted the curse, and killed an immortal.
I hoped to save Thaniel, as he saved me. But it was all for nothing.
My friend is gone - lost to the darkness. And I... I think I am too. I feel it - deep inside.

EditorData.NodeContext: heartbroken - he knows he's going to die soon

Text.Value: I don't know if this Duke Ravengard the same, but I will say this - the Flaming Fist are the cornerstone of the city, and the Dukes are its foundation.
Luck and stubbornness. I'm still weak, so the walk took... longer than I'd like to admit. But my health can wait.
You too, my friend. Thank you - from Thaniel and I.
When this land fell to the curse, I should have gone with it - Thaniel is the only reason I survived.
The truth is... the Shadowfell broke something inside me - something no healer can fix. I don't know how long I have.
Sorry, I didn't mean - I'm just worried.
The Flaming Fist are the cornerstone of Baldur's Gate - and the Dukes are its foundation. I hope you can save him.
Thank you, for trying to help us. I'm sure Thaniel would feel the same - wherever he is now.
I know foggy fragments of Eltan - all tall tales. What was he like?
I grew up hearing stories of Duke Eltan - I'm curious about what he was like.
I can't make you - nor can I go in your place. In truth... I do not know how much longer I will live. The Shadowfell's damage runs deep I fear.
I am, please don't mistake that. But saving me was in vain.
Thank you - it would have been an honour to serve under Duke Eltan.
What about the Flaming Fist you've met here? What do you think of them?
I'm sorry.
Any word on Thaniel? And the curse?
I have enough to deal with - some useless duke isn't my problem.
I beat Ketheric - that's something.
But - because of you, Thaniel is safe. Because of you, I could help him, as he helped me. So thank you, my friend, and know that I have no regrets.
I heard about Duke Ravengard capture. If his soldiers are anything to go by, he is a man to admire and respect.
And Thaniel has been trapped in that cursed darkness even longer than I. Please, help him. Please.
When Duke Eltan formed the Flaming Fist, he sought out people of courage and honour to fill its ranks.
And after Thaniel awakens?
He's gone, I can feel it.
But I've seen the respect he inspires in the Flaming Fist - and that tells me all I need about him as a leader.
I'm working on it.
Please, hurry. I don't know how much longer Thaniel can last.
I did.
Gruff. And intimidating. But he had the courage of ten men - and a love for Baldur's Gate few could match.
It's safe to say, you'd have been recruited in an instant.
Then I wish you luck. Thank you for your help.
I hope you can save Duke Ravengard - for the good of Baldur's Gate.
Once we leave, this place will be pretty empty. Will you be all right?
They are... different to what Duke Eltan envisioned.  And I can't comment on Duke Ravengard himself.
Besides - Thaniel should have someone here when he wakes up. It's the least I can do.
No. When I first awoke, I felt him. Here. But that's faded.

EditorData.NodeContext: touches heart on 'hear' , sad and distant

Text.Value: I just killed Ketheric and this is all you have to say?
Don't be. The Shadowfell claims everyone in the end - it just took its time with me.
What are you talking about?
Thaniel is gone... and with him, any chance of breaking the curse.
A Flaming Fist - a novice, actually. She dropped everything to make sure I made it here safe.
I never really cared about Thaniel anyway.
Last I saw you were bed-bound. How did you make it here?
Of course, I have no idea what life is like under Duke Ravengard's rule.
I hope you can save him - for the good of Baldur's Gate.
I don't think there will be an after.
I didn't want to tell you in Last Light, but the Shadowfell... broke something in me - something no healer can fix.

EditorData.NodeContext: a sad smile and shrug - he knows he's going to die

Text.Value: Please, - I don't know how much longer Thaniel can last in the Shadowfell. Help him - and hurry.
Thank you, but look at me - I am a relic: a glimpse of history barely strong enough to stand on his own two feet.
Surely there's something we can still do.
Come with me - I could use a Flaming Fist by my side.
But the Flaming Fist are the cornerstone of the city, and the Dukes are the foundation.
With great difficulty. Even after all that rest, I... don't seem to be getting better.
The Flaming Fist are nothing but mercenaries now. Immoral ones at that.

Synopsis: This covers arts three states 1) Thaniel is dead, which means the curse cannot be lifted [he is heartbroken and grieving] 2) the curse quest is in progress, and Thaniel hasn't been saved yet [he's worried for thaniel and frantic] and 3) curse has been lifted and Thaniel is safe [Art is grateful and contemplative, but also a little reserved - he knows he's going to die soon]
